comment: Professor Stewart is truly an amazing teacher! Her lectures are quite long and sometimes can be tedious but if you have the patience then you will truly enjoy listening to them! She makes each concept easy to understand! Her tests are a little difficult as not everything on the study guide is on it! But the concepts are interesting and enjoyable!

Dr. Stewart is a good professor. I took her for Social Psychology Spring 2025. It was a crazy semester just seem like a lot was going on. However, Dr. Stewart is understanding and was helpful. There was one group assignment. As a nontraditional student. I hate to see those coming. However, the assignment was easy. Awesome professor.

Professor Stewart is really difficult to listen to and want to engage in. She goes off topic quite a lot and her lecture slides have little to no information so be ready to write down EVERYTHING. Her exams are all open book and open note but it's all applied stuff so you still have to study and understand the meanings of everything.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Professor Stewart was one of the worst professors I've had. She's insanely scatterbrained & unorganized. I could not learn anything from her because of how many different topics she touched on at once. She does not allow food in or out of the classroom, even when at home on Teams. She does not clearly state how she wants her assignments, good luck.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Stewart is very knowledgeable and passionate about the psychology field. She is a tough grader but gives constructive feedback on your assignments, so you know exactly what you need to fix. She can be a little disorganized and frazzled but I learned a lot from her class and feel much more prepared for harder psych classes.

Dr. Stewart is the nicest professor you will ever meet. Research methods is basically one big group project and she helps you succeed the entire way. She is invested in every student individually and will make you love what you're learning. My TA Sarah was also amazing and made the tests a breeze.

Dr. Stewart has been the best professor I have had. She gives you a warning the first class that if you don't think the design of her class will work there are other options. The material taught in class is useful for anyone interested in psychology and the tests are easy if you just pay attention. She is very sweet and is quick to help whenever.

I would happily take Dr. Stewart again. The class was three tests and one project. For the tests, you need to take notes during her lectures and if she provides video lectures, you NEED to watch them. If you don't you'll be missing a lot of material for the tests. Project was easy, you basically say what grade you should receive and state why.

Absolutely love Dr. Stewart. She is very intense- you have to pay attention and do the work but she is very helpful. Lectures and reading are very important. Tests are applied knowledge so you can't google. Study guides are IMPERATIVE. If you love Psyc I highly recommend her.

She is amazing! However you have to work for your grade. 3 tests & a project where you grade yourself. If you don't attend her lectures, you won't pass. Her study guides are long, but if you do them, you will get an A. Make sure to read the textbook b/c there will be test questions on it. Pay attention in class & write down everything she says!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: She is a great professor! Tests aren't that difficult if you pay attention to the lectures but she makes them super interesting!

Took as a hybrid. Class itself is alright but the way she runs it is irritating to say the least. No laptops or phones, and her powerpoints barely cover anything so write what she says. She moves fairly fast too. Her exams are foolish. She asks questions about irrelevant facts that were mentioned once rather than on the actual material.
Really smart and sweet, took her for a hybrid. DO THE STUDY GUIDES.

Really cares. Opened up to the class a lot. Will teach you and prepare you for exams. 3 reflection papers. Online quiz weekly (Straight from text you read). Midterm and Final. Group project ab ATL museum. You will learn and want to learn with her teaching this subject. Give it a shot.

Narcissistic, full of herself, annoying, and completely disrespectful to other student viewpoints. Avoid like the plague! The absolute worst professor in the Psych dept. at KSU and I got an A in this class so I'm not biased.

I've taken Dr. Stewart for Experimental and Social and loved her. After taking experimental with her, social was a breeze! I would say you may have to get used to how she grades, but after that, it does not take a ridiculous amount of effort to succeed. Dr. Stewart is also a great resource outside of class for grad school stuff. Take her!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: With all honesty, she is highly annoying and she makes you feel like you are in middle school. A very boring teacher, she may seem excited but she gets off topic, so its easy to lose your focus Oh,and don't ask a questions cause she will just tell you to look at the syllabus . But her test are okay, but if you have a choice choose someone else . :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Took his class as a Maymester and I would definitely take it again. She makes the material very easy by giving examples. She gives a study guide for each exam and if you know the study guide you will get an A. Participation is 20 points so attend class, she also talks about things that are on the exam. She really cares & wants everyone to succeed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She cares. She rambles a bit in lecture but she will help you in class if you need it. LONG study guides, but if you know everything on them, you'll get an A. You don't lose points for not attending but if you do go to class, you have to be on time, no electronics, and not leave early. Otherwise you'll lose points.

Really thinks she's all that and a bag of chips. For the group project you do in this class, she would continuously make us change it. Each meeting she would pick it apart and then say it was fine, but then we would have to start all over the next time. She talks so much to the point you want to throw yourself at a wall.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This professor is an amazing teacher. She makes sure everyone understands the concepts fully before moving on to the next subject. She is very clear and concise about the materials. If you attend every class and take notes on lectures you will easily get an A.

She is condescending and narcissistic. Though she is passionate about her work and her courses, if you don't understand something the first time, don't bother asking again. She is very unhelpful with assignments and grades very harshly. Be prepared to take lots of notes and study heavily for tests without a guide for your countless pages of notes.

Dr. Stewart is my favorite professor I have ever had. I took her during maymester, but I wish I had the opportunity to take her for a full semester. Her lectures are extremely interesting, and she gives thorough explanations of each concept. The tests are simple, with the questions coming straight from her lectures. TAKE HER! You will love her!

I did like Dr. Stewart's enthusiasm. However her lectures were all over the place & when asked questions her answers weren't clear or  they were drawn out & off topic.  I would never take her again, she does not "teach". I practically had to teach myself her materials. Toughest class I've ever taken but use your group to your advantage.
Crazy but good. She is so obsessive about her field that she holds her class to a higher standard than most professors.

Loved this class! Love Dr. Stewart! Your grade: 2 (easy if you study, read, and go to class) tests, 3 short reflection papers, weekly quizzes, and a big final project. You learn a lot in this class and have fun doing it. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you'll regret it test time if you don't go. There's also extra credit.

Her lectures are so long but she gives great examples!! Her test are based mainly on the examples but she also gives a study guide a week before the exam! Attendance and participation matters! You really have to listen because the PowerPoints are not for visual learners at all! Not very big on extra credit! & no texting in class!!!

She'll try to scare you on the first day of class, but she just takes her work very seriously, and expects you to as well. When I took her, she was the only prof that actually had students design and complete an experiment using REAL DATAE (which was worth the struggle!) Experimental is HARD, but she's always willing to help!

Mrs. Stewart is awesome!!! She is very positive and willing to help. She expects her students to do great  and she is a bit weird (In a good way). I would take her again. If you want a teacher that challenges you she is the one to get. Her test are slightly hard if you cant apply what you learned but its all multiple choice.
Dr. Stewart is very enthusiastic. You can tell that she really enjoys her work. She truly cares about how well students do in her class. She is very helpful and is always willing to answer questions.

Dr. Stewart's Social class is a lot of work. If you don't attend lectures, you won't make it through the tests. But class is always interesting and fun! She gives a study guide a week before exams and it is long, but it's a must in order to pass! I would take another class with her!

Social psychology is her LIFE.  Expects you to be as into it as she is.  Gives really long study guides but if you do them you can make an A.  Have to participate.  Attendance not mandatory but can't come in late.

Dr. Stewart is awesome. You can tell she loves psychology and teaching and is extremely helpful if you ask. Experimental is tough with any teacher, so you have to be prepared to work hard. Come to class, do your homework, pay attention, and  you'll do fine.

She is new to KSU, but a great professor! You need to come to class and take good notes to do well. Also, if you use the book and do the study guide you should do fine. She's very open and is very good at making the material understandable with personal experiences. Definitely take her class!
